title: How to Properly Clean Your Ninja Coffee Machine

steps.title: Clean your coffee maker whenever the “clean” light illuminates.
steps.content: Clean your coffee maker whenever the “clean” light illuminates. The “clean” button is located at the bottom right of your coffee maker. You’ll know it’s time to clean your unit when a thin red light appears under the word “clean.” [1] X Research source Although you’ll still be able to make a pot of coffee if the clean light is on, you’ll still want to clean your unit as soon as possible. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Pour descaling solution and water into the reservoir up to the “Max Fill” line.
steps.content: Pour descaling solution and water into the reservoir up to the “Max Fill” line. Descaling solution helps remove calcium buildup from your machine, which can improve its performance and the flavor of your coffee. Look at the directions on the specific bottle of descaling solution you’re using to find out exactly how much solution to use. [3] X Research source You can purchase descaling solution at your local supermarket, or on the manufacturer’s website.

steps.title: Use white vinegar instead of descaling solution to save money.
steps.content: Use white vinegar instead of descaling solution to save money. White vinegar works just as well as descaling solution and is also cheaper. [4] X Expert Source James Sears House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 28 August 2019. [5] X Expert Source Marcus Shields House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 22 September 2019. Start by pouring vinegar into the water reservoir up to the “travel mug” line, or about 16 fluid ounces (470 mL). Then, add water until the liquid reaches the “Max Fill” line. [6] X Research source Use only white vinegar. Other types of vinegar—such as rice vinegar, balsamic vinegar, or black vinegar—won’t work. The travel mug line is the second line from the bottom on your water reservoir. Be careful never to fill your reservoir above the Max Fill line. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Turn the dial on your unit to the “Full Carafe” size and set up the carafe.
steps.content: Turn the dial on your unit to the “Full Carafe” size and set up the carafe. To do this, turn the dial on your unit all the way to the right. Be sure to also put the carafe under the brew basket before beginning. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Press the “clean” button to begin the clean cycle.
steps.content: Press the “clean” button to begin the clean cycle. When you press the “clean” button, the letters “CLN” and the countdown timer of the clean cycle will appear on the clock display. Don’t press any other buttons while the clean cycle is running. [9] X Research source A clean cycle will usually last around 1 hour. Although, clean times may vary depending on the model you have.

steps.title: Empty the carafe once the clean cycle ends.
steps.content: Empty the carafe once the clean cycle ends. When the clean cycle ends, the light next to the clock display will flash, and the word “Flush” will appear on the display. To empty the carafe, simply pour the liquid into your sink. [10] X Research source The liquid in the carafe will be hot, just like freshly-brewed coffee, so be careful when pouring it out.

steps.title: Refill the reservoir with tap water and press the “clean” button again.
steps.content: Refill the reservoir with tap water and press the “clean” button again. Once you’ve poured the liquid out of your carafe, put the carafe back under the brew basket. Then, fill the reservoir up to the “Max Fill” line with water. [11] X Research source This first flush will take around 8 minutes. You don’t need to add descaling solution or white vinegar for this step.

steps.title: Run another clean cycle with only water.
steps.content: Run another clean cycle with only water. Once the clean cycle with water finishes, dump out the water, and repeat the flushing process. These flushing cycles will help clear the descaling solution, or white vinegar, out of your machine, keeping your next pot of coffee fresh and tasty. [12] X Expert Source James Sears House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 28 August 2019. [13] X Research source
